content: I read over the survey and have thoughts!
I will try to collect them in some form, however :P
Issues are likely to be the best from our end, but of course however you want to provide feedback, we'll take it!

I wrote up a quick hackmd: https://hackmd.io/@nikomatsakis/Syy4DDDrt

Happy to discuss in more detail!

Some questions back at you:

  • When you were looking at the survey had this been merged yet? I like your point about finding out what Rust is good for. We can certainly do better, but I think that PR is a good first step. I'll add an issue for this.
  • Onboarding time is tough to measure. Even two people with the same background make take wildly different amounts of calendar time to onboard simply due to one being able to dedicate more time vs the other to the learning process. I think what we want to know here is about effort. What aspects of Rust took the most effort to learn. This will also differ between those who learned Rust 5 years ago vs more recently, but luckily we're much more prepared to do cohort analysis on this type now.
  • re: asking people why they stopped using Rust - we removed this question because it was in our opinion extremely hard to figure out how representative a sample of ex-Rust users the survey takers would be. While we can never be fully sure of representativeness of our survey, ex-users who take the survey are less likely to be representative than current users who take the survey.
@rylev No, I had not seen rust-lang/surveys#84. I agree that's a step in the right direction.
Regarding your second point, I agree it is hard to measure, and I am open to the idea that the survey is not the right tool

Regarding the third point, that makes sense, but it still seems surprising to me that we aren't trying to get data on "if you don't use rust, what would make it appealing to you". I guess a fair argument is: this is the wrong tool to get that data
Does that sound like what you are saying?
How do you feel @rylev about me pointing other people at the draft for feedback?

rylev said:

Yes that's essentially what I'm saying.

I think I buy it

nikomatsakis said:

How do you feel rylev about me pointing other people at the draft for feedback?

Sounds good - we're ready for open feedback, we're just not sharing it fully publicly (e.g., Twitter) to avoid the potential for lots of unhelpful feedback.
FYI: I believe all of the feedback from the hackmd has been incorporated into the survey (or at least discussed)
